title: Compound Boolean with x, y, and result

content.question: int x = /* some integer value */ ; int y = /* some integer value */ ; boolean result = (x < y); result = ( (x >= y) && !result ); Which of the following best describes the conditions under which the value of result will be true after the code segment is executed?

choices.label: Only when x and y are equal
The value will always be true.
The value will never be true.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe the initial conditions that must be met for a code segment to work as intended or described.
